channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: 2023 Brisbane Comedy Festival
item.description:
Sunday, April 30, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support 2023 Brisbane Comedy Festival.

Brisbane Powerhouse brings people together to create and experience adventurous arts. Our vision is clear: we act as a creative powerhouse for work authentically made in Brisbane, facilitating the collaborations and conversations between that work and the rest of the world. Brisbane Comedy Festival returns in 2023, bursting at the seams to host a hand-picked selection of the funniest folk in the country. Held from 28 April to 28 May 2023, this multi-venue laughter extravaganza held across Brisbane Powerhouse, The Tivoli and The Fortitude Music Hall, plays host to one-liners, whimsy and tall tales from some of the most hilarious comedians around. From stand-up to improv and sketch comedy, and everything in between.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Powerhouse

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Domestic and Family Violence Prevention Awareness Month
item.description:
Monday, May 1, 2023

City Hall will be lit Purple to support Domestic and Family Violence Prevention Awareness Month.

Each May, Queensland marks Domestic and Family Violence Prevention Month (DFVP Month) to raise community awareness of domestic and family violence (DFV) and to send a clear message that DFV in families and homes will not be tolerated.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Justice and Attorney General

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Domestic Violence Remembrance Day and Candlelight Vigil
item.description:
Tuesday, May 2, 2023

City Hall will be lit Purple to support Domestic Violence Remembrance Day and Candlelight Vigil.

Domestic Violence organisations and networks in Queensland that have been advocating for change are striving to have as many monuments and buildings in their local area lit up purple during DFV Prevention month.

This Light Up is organised by: Micah Projects - Brisbane Domestic Violence Services

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Lung Health Awareness Month
item.description:
Tuesday, May 2, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Green to support Lung Health Awareness Month.

May marks Lung Health Awareness Month and we are raising awareness about the importance of lung health and the signs and symptoms of lung disease. Anyone can get lung disease – it affects approximately 7 million Australians and is the second leading cause of death in this country. Despite this, many people ignore the signs and symptoms of lung disease for far too long. We are raising awareness about the symptoms of lung disease and encouraging people to check in with their lungs.

This Light Up is organised by: Lung Foundation Australia

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Domestic Violence Remembrance Day and Candlelight Vigil
item.description:
Wednesday, May 3, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Domestic Violence Remembrance Day and Candlelight Vigil.

Domestic Violence organisations and networks in Queensland that have been advocating for change are striving to have as many monuments and buildings in their local area lit up purple during DFV Prevention month, particularly for DFV Remembrance day which in 2023 falls on Wednesday the 3rd of May.

This Light Up is organised by: Micah Projects - Brisbane Domestic Violence Services

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Anywhere Festival
item.description:
Thursday, May 4, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to celebrate Anywhere Festival.

Anywhere Theatre Festival Limited makes it possible for local performance makers to present performance anywhere, to take creative risks without the financial risks. Anywhere Festival is our annual festival of performances in nooks and crannies anywhere but a theatre running for eighteen days in May.

This Light Up is organised by: Anywhere Theatre

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2023 LGBTQ Light up the Night Charity Gala
item.description:
Friday, May 5, 2023

City Hall will be lit Rainbow to celebrate 2023 LGBTQ Light up the Night Charity Gala.

The Light Up the Night Charity Gala to be held in the main auditorium of City Hall aims to create change and bring greater awareness to LGBTQ Domestic Violence and ensure that all people no matter their sexuality or gender identity can feel seen and believed and receive safe and inclusive support.

This Light Up is organised by: LGBTQ Domestic Violence Awareness Foundation

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Magic Round
item.description:
Friday, May 5, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Green to support Magic Round.

NRL Magic Round will bring 16 teams to Brisbane to play 8 matches at Suncorp Stadium over 3 magical days. A sporting spectacular for the city, Brisbane Economic Development Agency would like to support this major event expected to drive significant economic benefits to Brisbane by lighting city assets in a rotation of team colours.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: International Thalassaemia Day
item.description:
Tuesday, May 9, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support International Thalassaemia Day.

Celebrated on the 8th of May, the International Thalassaemia Day is devoted to raising awareness amongst the general public and decisionmakers about thalassaemia, promoting and strengthening the lifelong and difficult struggle of patients against this severe blood disease, and commemorating all the people who are no longer with us, while renewing our promise to keep fighting until the final cure for thalassaemia is found.

This Light Up is organised by: Thalassaemia and Sickle Cell Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.description:
Thursday, May 11, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support Eve of Do It For Dolly Day.

Do It For Dolly Day is a day dedicated to bringing the community together, spreading kindness and uniting in taking a stand against bullying. Each year in May, Dolly's Dream sees thousands of its supporters come together to commemorate Dolly, and participate in fundraising activities to help support the important anti-bullying work Dolly's Dream does to create positive change within the broader community.

This Light Up is organised by: The Alannah & Madeline Foundation

item.title: ME/CFS/ MF Awareness Day
item.description:
Friday, May 12, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue to support ME/CFS/ MF Awareness Day.

ME/CFS/FM Support Association Qld Inc., helps sufferers of Myalgic Encephalomyelitis/Chronic Fatigue Syndrome and Fibromyalgia (ME/CFS/FM) by spreading awareness and sending them free information kits as well as having support groups meetings and a Facebook page. Its Annual International ME/CFS/FM Awareness Week which is celebrated all around the world to spread awareness on how debilitating ME/CFS and Fibromyalgia are.

This Light Up is organised by: ME/CFS/FM Support Association Qld Inc

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point

Its Annual International ME/CFS/FM Awareness Week which is celebrated all around the world to spread awareness on how debilitating ME/CFS and Fibromyalgia are.
This Light Up is organised by: ME/CFS/FM Support Association Qld Inc
item.x-trumba:customfield: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2023 Brisbane Art Design Festival
item.description:
Saturday, May 13, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Yellow to support 2023 Brisbane Art Design Festival.

BRISBANE ART DESIGN Festival is a bi-annual festival that celebrates the diverse arts, design and cultural accomplishments of our city. Featuring over 106 events over three weekends (including Botanica: Contemporary Art Outside which attracts an annual audience of 90,000+ visitors).

This Light Up is organised by: Museum of Brisbane

item.title: ATSICHS 50th Anniversary
item.description:
Saturday, May 13, 2023

City Hall will be lit Aboriginal and Torres Strait Island Flag Colours to recognise ATSICHS 50th Anniversary.

ATSICHS Brisbane is a leading Indigenous organisation in SE Qld. ATSICHS Brisbane delivers health and dental services, human services, social health programs and kindergartens to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and this year marks the 50th anniversary of ATSICHS Brisbane.

This Light Up is organised by: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Community Health Service

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: National Road Safety Week
item.description:
Sunday, May 14, 2023

Sandgate Hall will be lit Yellow to support National Road Safety Week.

National Road Safety Week (NRSW) aims to remember 1200 people killed on Australian roads each year in road crashes. The week aims to encourage people to take a pledge to drive so others survive and to wear a yellow ribbon to remember those lost to road trauma. Each year, national landmarks are lit yellow around the country to show their support for NRSW. Lit landmarks aim to reinforce the theme "everyone has the right to get home safe".

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Transport and Main Roads

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

item.title: Light the Way
item.description:
Monday, May 15, 2023

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to support Light the Way.

TSA (Tuberous Sclerosis Australia) is wanting to raise awareness by shining a light on May 15 to continue to please help shine a light on the devastating rare disease, TSC (Tuberous Sclerosis Complex). We are reaching out to you today to invite you to “Light the Way” for children, adults and families impacted by the devastating rare disease TSC (Tuberous Sclerosis Complex).

This Light Up is organised by: Tuberous Sclerosis Australia Inc.

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: National Volunteer Week
item.description:
Monday, May 15, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to support National Volunteer Week.

National Volunteer Week is the premier event which recognises and honours the essential and valuable work and the volunteer-involving organisations that engage them to support the achievement of their purpose and mission. Volunteering Queensland,alongside Volunteering Australia and the other state peak bodies lead the nation in celebrating the important work of volunteers across the country.

This Light Up is organised by: Volunteering Queensland

item.title: Eve of WOW Day
item.description:
Tuesday, May 16, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Orange to support Eve of WOW Day.

Wear Orange Wednesday, or WOW Day is the national day to celebrate and thank SES volunteers. It takes place annually on the Wednesday of National Volunteer Week, this year taking place on Wednesday 17 May 2023. In honour of this day, we take the time to thank our Queensland SES volunteers for their dedication and tireless devotion to their communities.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland State Emergency Services Volunteer Association Inc

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: IDAHOBIT
item.description:
Wednesday, May 17, 2023

Sandgate Hall will be lit Rainbow to support IDAHOBIT.

Brisbane City Council - River City Pride  wants to light up Brisbane in celebration and awareness of IDAHOBIT Day 2023.  On May 17, 1990 - the World Health Organization removed homosexuality from the Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems. While we celebrate this milestone and other advancements in LGBTQIA+ equality, the unfortunate reality is that there's still more work to do.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council - River City Pride

Venue: Sandgate Town Hall, Sandgate
Venue address: Sandgate Town Hall, Cliff and Seymour Streets, Sandgate

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council - River City Pride

item.title: Australian Heavy Vehicle Industry Week
item.description:
Thursday, May 18, 2023

City Hall will be lit Blue, Yellow and Green to support Australian Heavy Vehicle Industry Week.

Australian Heavy Vehicle Industry (AHVI) Week focuses on promoting the heavy vehicle industry’s values around a set of key themes: safety, innovation, sustainability, careers, knowledge and community. One of its goals it to foster broader community awareness about the heavy vehicle industry’s vital role and positive impact within the community.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: 2023 Paniyiri Greek Festival
item.description:
Friday, May 19, 2023

The Story Bridge will be lit Blue and White to celebrate 2023 Paniyiri Greek Festival.

Paniyiri is Brisbane's festival of everything Greek, featuring an exciting cultural celebration of food, dance, music, art, cooking, live entertainment and history. An eagerly anticipated annual event, Paniyiri unites the Greek Community of South East Queensland with the general community in a celebration of fun, food and friendship.

This Light Up is organised by: Greek Orthodox Community of St George

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Make NF Shine and World Neurofibromatosis Awareness Month
item.description:
Monday, May 22, 2023

The Tropical Dome will be lit Blue to support Make NF Shine and World Neurofibromatosis Awareness Month.

Make NF shine, NF awareness day brings awareness to Neurofibromatosis for those who don't know what the condition it is, the day also supports those 1,000 people within Brisbane living with the condition and those affected.

This Light Up is organised by: Children's Tumour Foundation

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong
